Rules of the game

Setup
  • Pick a room you want to play in:
    • Random room - play with another random player who also joined random room
    • Create room - create a new room and invite your friend to join you
    • Join room - input code of the exisiting room to play with your friend
  • The deck contains 54 cards. Each card belongs to one of six domains and has a value between 1 and 9. Domains and values are presented below.
  • Before the game starts, cards are shuffled and distributed evenly among the players. Each player receives 27 cards:
    • 6 cards to the hand - those are the cards the player can use during his/hers turn
    • 21 cards to the deck - after card from the hand is played, one card from the deck will go to player's hand
Gameplay
  • Throughtout the game players compete against each other to claim markers that are inbetween them. To do this, during a player's turn, player takes a card from the hand and puts it in one of the zones. This card cannot be moved any more. Then next card from player's deck will be added to his/hers hand and may be played in next round. When both players play 3 cards to one zone the player who created better formation claims the marker. Those formations are similar to those found in poker and have the similar priority. Those formations are explained below. If two formations are identical, player that created his/hers formation first claims the marker. Note: It is possible to claim a marker before the opponent places 3 cards, but only if it can be proven that opponent's formation would not be able to beat player's combination of cards (no matter what card would be played next).
End of the game
  • The game ends when a player claims 3 adjacent markers or any 5 of them. This player is declared a winner.

Cards - domains, values and formations

Values and domains
  • Cards in the same row belong to the same domain
  • Values of the cards grow from left to right
Formations
  • Straight-flush - cards of the same domain with consecutive values
  • Three-of-a-kind - cards with the same values
  • Flush - cards of the same domain
  • Straight - cards with consecutive values
  • Card set - combination of different cards
  • If both players create the same type of formation, the one whose sum of the values is higher wins
  • When both formations are exactly the same, player that created formation earlier wins
  • Note: order in which the cards were played does not affect the formation
  • Note: based on cards played, it is possible to determine that the formation cannot be beaten. In such case marker can be claimed before opponent playes all 3 cards
